title: Why the All Blacks' 'no dickheads' policy is simply a New Zealand myth
text:
Eddie Jones could not have been more scornful when he was asked at his World Cup squad announcement back in August whether he would be adopting a player-led model of self-policing in line with New Zealand’s.

“You’ve been reading that book,” the England head coach said. “You believe it. Every team has problems… don’t believe that book, which everyone seems to base their opinion on teams on. No team’s like that – every team has its problems. I’m sure we’ll have our problems and we’ll deal with it.”

The book in question was Legacy by James Kerr. After spending a year behind the scenes...
description: Eddie Jones could not have been more scornful when he was asked at his World Cup squad announcement back in August whether he would be adopting a player-led model of self-policing in line with New Zealand’s.
